summary.long: Habakkuk is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The burden which the prophet Habakkuk saw.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, how long shall I cry,
And You will not hear?
Even cry out to You, “Violence!”
And You will not save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do You show me iniquity,
And cause me to see trouble?
For plundering and violence are before me;
There is strife, and contention arises.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore the law is powerless,
And justice never goes forth.
For the wicked surround the righteous;
Therefore perverse judgment proceeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Look among the nations and watch—
Be utterly astounded!
For I will work a work in your days
Which you would not believe, though it were told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For indeed I am raising up the Chaldeans,
A bitter and hasty nation
Which marches through the breadth of the earth,
To possess dwelling places that are not theirs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are terrible and dreadful;
Their judgment and their dignity proceed from themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They scoff at kings,
And princes are scorned by them.
They deride every stronghold,
For they heap up earthen mounds and seize it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Are You not from everlasting,
O Lord my God, my Holy One?
We shall not die.
O Lord, You have appointed them for judgment;
O Rock, You have marked them for correction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are of purer eyes than to behold evil,
And cannot look on wickedness.
Why do You look on those who deal treacherously,
And hold Your tongue when the wicked devours
A person more righteous than he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do You make men like fish of the sea,
Like creeping things that have no ruler over them?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They take up all of them with a hook,
They catch them in their net,
And gather them in their dragnet.
Therefore they rejoice and are glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore they sacrifice to their net,
And burn incense to their dragnet;
Because by them their share is sumptuous
And their food plentiful.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall they therefore empty their net,
And continue to slay nations without pity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will stand my watch
And set myself on the rampart,
And watch to see what He will say to me,
And what I will answer when I am corrected.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord answered me and said:
“Write the vision
And make it plain on tablets,
That he may run who reads it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Indeed, because he transgresses by wine,
He is a proud man,
And he does not stay at home.
Because he enlarges his desire as hell,
And he is like death, and cannot be satisfied,
He gathers to himself all nations
And heaps up for himself all peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Will not all these take up a proverb against him,
And a taunting riddle against him, and say,
‘Woe to him who increases
What is not his—how long?
And to him who loads himself with many pledges’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will not your creditors rise up suddenly?
Will they not awaken who oppress you?
And you will become their booty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because you have plundered many nations,
All the remnant of the people shall plunder you,
Because of men’s blood
And the violence of the land and the city,
And of all who dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who covets evil gain for his house,
That he may set his nest on high,
That he may be delivered from the power of disaster!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You give shameful counsel to your house,
Cutting off many peoples,
And sin against your soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the stone will cry out from the wall,
And the beam from the timbers will answer it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who builds a town with bloodshed,
Who establishes a city by iniquity!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, is it not of the Lord of hosts
That the peoples labor to feed the fire,
And nations weary themselves in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the earth will be filled
With the knowledge of the glory of the Lord,
As the waters cover the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Woe to him who gives drink to his neighbor,
Pressing him to your bottle,
Even to make him drunk,
That you may look on his nakedness!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You are filled with shame instead of glory.
You also—drink!
And be exposed as uncircumcised!
The cup of the Lord’s right hand will be turned against you,
And utter shame will be on your glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the violence done to Lebanon will cover you,
And the plunder of beasts which made them afraid,
Because of men’s blood
And the violence of the land and the city,
And of all who dwell in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“What profit is the image, that its maker should carve it,
The molded image, a teacher of lies,
That the maker of its mold should trust in it,
To make mute idols?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Woe to him who says to wood, ‘Awake!’
To silent stone, ‘Arise! It shall teach!’
Behold, it is overlaid with gold and silver,
Yet in it there is no breath at all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“But the Lord is in His holy temple.
Let all the earth keep silence before Him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, on Shigionoth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God came from Teman,
The Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah 
His glory covered the heavens,
And the earth was full of His praise.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Before Him went pestilence,
And fever followed at His feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stood and measured the earth;
He looked and startled the nations.
And the everlasting mountains were scattered,
The perpetual hills bowed.
His ways are everlasting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction;
The curtains of the land of Midian trembled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O Lord, were You displeased with the rivers,
Was Your anger against the rivers,
Was Your wrath against the sea,
That You rode on Your horses,
Your chariots of salvation?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The mountains saw You and trembled;
The overflowing of the water passed by.
The deep uttered its voice,
And lifted its hands on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You marched through the land in indignation;
You trampled the nations in anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You went forth for the salvation of Your people,
For salvation with Your Anointed.
You struck the head from the house of the wicked,
By laying bare from foundation to neck. Selah
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You thrust through with his own arrows
The head of his villages.
They came out like a whirlwind to scatter me;
Their rejoicing was like feasting on the poor in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You walked through the sea with Your horses,
Through the heap of great waters.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Yet I will rejoice in the Lord,
I will joy in the God of my salvation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord God is my strength;
He will make my feet like deer’s feet,
And He will make me walk on my high hills.
To the Chief Musician. With my stringed instruments.
verses.speaker: Narrator
